snippet: The Shabab, a Somali Islamist extremist group linked to Al Qaeda, claimed responsibility for the attack, The Associated Press reported.
abstract: Extremist group Shabab claims responsibility for roadside bomb that killed at least four United Nations Children's Fund staff members in northeastern Somalia.
lead_paragraph: The Shabab, a Somali Islamist extremist group linked to Al Qaeda, claimed responsibility for the attack, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: Roadside Bomb in Somalia Kills 4 Unicef Workers
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Somalia: Unicef Workers Die in Attack
